--- ## layout is required for building the site - DO NOT edit this layout: events # ---------------------- TESTTWF EVENT PAGE TEMPLATE --------------------------- # # This is an English-only starter page for your event. Most of the content of # your page will be defined in this header in YAML format between the # --- separators above and below. You are free to insert HTML anywhere in the # page below the last --- separator. Follow the guidelines in each section # to fill in the details of your event. You can look at other past event pages # for examples of different ways to set them up. Note that this website # structure was adopted after several event pages were already in place. Some # events have only been partially converted to this new format. # # To see built example of this starter page, see: # http://testthewebforward.org/events/events/kits/resources/site/page-template-en.html # # See the final steps for previewing and sending the pull request. If you have # questions, send mail to public-testtwf-planning@w3.org. # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # ---------------------------- CITY + DATE ------------------------------------- # city: REQUIRED # date: REQUIRED # # Example: # city: London, England # date: January 1st, 2000 # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ city: Your City, State date: Month DD, Year # ------------------------------ REGISTRATION----------------------------------- # registration_link: OPTIONAL # # Example: # registration_link: http://ttwf-seattle.eventbrite.com # # For a live example of how the registration link button is displayed, see: # http://testthewebforward.org/events/2013/seattle.html # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## registration_link: http://link.to.registration.page # ------------------------------ SPONSORS -------------------------------------- # sponsors: OPTIONAL # # Comma delimited list of the event sponsors. Each person in this list must # have an entry in the _config.yml file in the "sponsors" list. # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ sponsors: [] # ------------------------------ SPEAKERS -------------------------------------- # speakers: OPTIONAL # # Comma delimited list of the event speakers. Each person in this list must # have an entry in the _config.yml file in the "people" list. # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ speakers: [] # ------------------------------ EXPERTS --------------------------------------- # experts: OPTIONAL # # Comma delimited list of the event experts. Each person in this list must # have an entry in the _config.yml file in the "people" list. # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ experts: [] # ------------------------------ Schedule -------------------------------------- # schedule: RECOMMENDED # # The schedule can be defined for one or two day events. # # One day event example: # # schedule: # default: # Agenda: # "8:30am - 9:00am": "Registration and Welcome Breakfast" # "9:00am - 9:30am": "Intro and Keynote" # "9:30am - 10:00am": "How to Create a W3C Reftest" # "10:00am - 10:30am": "Overview of Testharness.js" # "10:30am - 12:00pm": "Test Sprint" # "12:00pm - 1:00pm": "Lunch" # "1:00pm - 6:30pm": "Test Sprint" # "6:30pm - 7:00pm": "Wrap up and Surface Pro give-away" # "7:00pm - 8:00pm": " Drinks & hors d'oeuvres" # # Two day event example: # # schedule: # default: # Friday's Sessions: # "6:30pm - 7:00pm": Check-in # "7:00pm - 7:10pm": Welcome & Introduction, Shigeo Okamoto # "7:10pm - 7:25pm": How To Read W3C Specifications, Kazuaki Takemura # "7:25pm - 7:40pm": Specification and Test Lifecycles, Oli Studholme # "7:40pm - 8:15pm": 3 Minute Lightning Talks By Experts # "8:15pm - 8:30pm": Pick a group, based on Lightning Talks # "8:30pm - 10:00pm": Free Dinner/Drinks # Saturday's Sessions: # "9:00am - 9:30am": Breakfast # "9:30am - 9:45pm": Testharness.js Essentials, Daniel Davis # "9:45am - 10:00pm": Anatomy of a Ref Test, Rebecca Hauck # "10:00am - 12:00pm": Hack # "12:00pm": Lunch is served # "12:00pm - 3:00pm": Hack # "3:00pm": Snacks # "3:00pm - 5:30pm": Hack # "5:30pm - 6:00pm": Demos # "6:00pm": Free After Party # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ #schedule: # default: # Agenda: # ------------------------------ LOCATION -------------------------------------- # location: RECOMMENDED # # The name and address of the event venue # # Example: # location: # venue: "Shenzhen Wuzhou Guest House" # link: http://www.wuzhouguesthouse.com/en/index.aspx (OPTIONAL) # address: ["6001 Shennan Road", "Shenzhen, China 518034"] # # Note: Each item in address array will display on its own line. You # may add as many items as you need here. # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ #location: # venue: "Venue Name" # link: "Venue website" # address: ["Street", "City, State, Zip"] # ------------------------------ FOCUS SPECS ----------------------------------- # focus_specs: OPTIONAL # # If you'll be highlighting certain specs at your event, they can be # include the Requirements section of the page. # # Example: # HTML5: # "HTML5 Forms" : "http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/forms.html" # CSS: # "CSS Basic User Interface": "http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-ui/" # "CSS Shapes": "http://www.w3.org/TR/css-shapes/" # "CSS Masking": "http://www.w3.org/TR/css-masking/" # FXTF: # "Compositing & Blending": "http://dev.w3.org/fxtf/compositing-1/" # Browser and Testing Tools: # "WebDriver": "http://www.w3.org/TR/webdriver/" # Accessibility: # "Accessibility Testing": "/docs/test-a11y.html" # # For a live example of how the focus specs appear in the Requirements # section, see: # http://testthewebforward.org/events/2013/shenzhen.html#requirements # # Note: The live example is bilingual. For this English-only template, # the focus specs will only appear once in English. # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ---

About

This is a basic event page template in English only. This About section should include a brief description of your event, its goals, and why it's important to your community. {% include events/schedule.html schedule=page.schedule %} {% include events/speakers.html speakers=page.speakers %} {% include events/experts.html experts=page.experts %} {% include events/location.html map_link="" map_embed="" %} {% include events/requirements.html %} {% include events/sponsors.html %}
